description: Demolition of existing conservatory and erection of part single part double rear/side extensions including conversion of garage to habitable space and associated changes to fenestration. Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions with installation of 2no front and 1no side rooflights to facilitate loft conversion.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The flat roof area(s) of the development to which this permission relates shall not be used as a roof garden, balcony, seating area or other similar amenity area, and shall not be accessed except for the purpose of maintenance or in the case of emergency.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at first floor level or above in the south (side) elevation shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, details of secure cycle parking facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant should note that the grant of this certificate is based on the principle of moving from C3(a) to C3(b) only.The applicant has provided no proposed layout and no details as to how the use would operate. It is stated that the proposal relates to vulnerable people but does not expand upon this. For clarity the applicant is advised to submit a further certificate application providing full disclosure of how the proposed use would be laid out and operated to allow the LPA to determine that the actual way in which the property is to be used fits within the definition of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) use Class C3(b) and for example does not fall within a C2 Use Class or Sui Generis which would constitute development and would require the need for planning permission.

The application is made for a certificate of Lawful Development or Use. Section 55 of the Town Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) provides a definition of the 'Meaning of "development" and "new development".' It states - '(1)Subject to the following provisions of this section, in this Act, except where the context otherwise requires, "development," means the carrying out of building, engineering, mining or other operations in, on, over or under land, or the making of any material change in the use of any buildings or other land.'Section 55 (2) states:(2)The following operations or uses of land shall not be taken for the purposes of this Act to involve development of the land—(f) in the case of buildings or other land which are used for a purpose of any class specified in an order made by the Secretary of State under this section, the use of the buildings or other land or, subject to the provisions of the order, of any part of the buildings or the other land, for any other purpose of the same class.The applicant states that the current use of the site is C3 (a) dwelling house as defined by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended). The applicant seeks a Lawful Development or Use for a C3(b) Use as defined by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended). The applicant has stated in their planning statement that the use of the premises would be for vulnerable people. No further details have been provided. The Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) provides the following definition. Class C3. Dwelling housesUse as a dwelling house (whether or not as a sole or main residence) —(a)by a single person or by people living together as a family, or(b)by not more than 6 residents living together as a single household (including a household where care is provided for residents).In this Order, unless the context otherwise requires:—"care" means personal care for people in need of such care by reason of old age, disablement, past or present dependence on alcohol or drugs or past or present mental disorder, and in class C2 also includes the personal care of children and medical care and treatment;In the case of a building used for a purpose within class C3 (dwelling houses) in the Schedule, the use as a separate dwelling house of any part of the building or of any land occupied with and used for the same purposes as the building is not, by virtue of this Order, to be taken as not amounting to development.The proposal does not constitute development as per the definition of S55 of the TCPA 1990 and the definition in the Use Classes order as amended and the change is considered lawful.

The submitted "Householder Checklist " has 'N' in biodiversity checklist, since we have received that document, please amend the householder checklist with correct information.The new Householder Local List and Checklist can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications

We have received the householder planning application for front porch extension, therefore we require all the documents according to our local list. If you consider it as permitted dvelopment, please submit application for lawful development for proposed use.With regards to the type of application, please refer to the Planning Portal websitehttps://www.planningportal.co.uk/permission/responsibilities/planning-permission/ and https://www.planningportal.co.uk/
